questions.text: A 45-year-old woman comes to the clinic for a routine check-up. As part of her assessment, her high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) levels are measured. Her hs-CRP levels are found to be elevated. The clinician is aware of a study that examined the relationship between hs-CRP levels and the risk of myocardial infarction (MI) or stroke in women. The study divided participants into groups based on their hs-CRP levels and found a significant relationship between hs-CRP levels and the relative risk of MI/Stroke. Based on the study's findings, what can be concluded about the relationship between hs-CRP levels and the risk of MI/Stroke?

options.label: A
options.text: hs-CRP has no relation to MI/Stroke risk

options.label: B
options.text: An increase in hs-CRP decreases MI/Stroke risk

options.label: C
options.text: An increase in hs-CRP levels increases MI/Stroke risk

options.label: D
options.text: A decrease in hs-CRP levels increases MI/Stroke risk

questions.correct_answer: C. An increase in hs-CRP levels increases MI/Stroke risk

questions.text: Match the following pioneers of preventive medicine with their respective achievements: Column 1 A. Louis Pasteur B. James Lind C. Walter Reed Column 2 I. Transmission of Yellow Fever II. Rabies vaccine III. Prevention of Scurvy

A 35-year-old public health researcher is reviewing various indices used to measure poverty in a population. While discussing the Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI), they note that it encompasses various deprivations faced by individuals in their daily lives. However, they identify one aspect that is not included in the MPI. Which of the following is not a deprivation included in the Multidimensional Poverty Index?

A 40-year-old public health specialist is evaluating various interventions under the category of primary prevention, specifically focusing on specific protection measures. They identify one intervention that does not fall under the category of specific protection. Which of the following does not include specific protection under primary prevention?

options.label: A
options.text: Administration of Rifampicin to those in contact with meningitis case

options.label: D
options.text: Fortification of wheat flour with added iron

questions.text: During an outbreak investigation at a local community event, public health officials determine that a foodborne illness was caused by a single contaminated food item. Which of the following statements is true about this single exposure, point source epidemic?

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs in more than 1 incubation period

questions.correct_answer: B. Occurs in one incubation period
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Occurs in one incubation period

questions.text: An epidemiologist is analyzing the distribution patterns of a recent disease outbreak within a city. Which of the following does the spot map, primarily depict?
In a ward of 100 patients, there are 10 diabetics. What is the probability of selecting three patients randomly and all turn out to be diabetic?

A new diagnostic test has been introduced that can detect a certain disease one year earlier than it is usually detected. Assume that early detection has no effect on the natural history of the disease, and there are no changes in death certification practices during the 10 years following the introduction of the test. Which of the following is most likely to happen to the disease within the 10 years after the test is introduced?

options.label: A
options.text: The period prevalence rate will decrease

options.label: B
options.text: The apparent 5-year survival rate will increase

options.label: C
options.text: The age-adjusted mortality rate will decrease

questions.correct_answer: B. The apparent 5-year survival rate will increase

questions.text: Case fatality rate is a measure of?

In a rural farming community, several adults have been diagnosed with a rare form of liver disease. The local clinic suspects that exposure to a pesticide used on nearby farms is the cause. To investigate the association between pesticide exposure and the liver disease, a case-control study is planned. Adults diagnosed with the liver disease who have been exposed to the pesticide will be taken as cases. Who should be taken as controls?

options.label: A
options.text: Adults in the same community with the liver disease who are exposed to the pesticide

options.label: B
options.text: Adults in the same community without the liver disease who are not exposed to the pesticide

options.label: C
options.text: Adults from the clinic with the liver disease who are exposed to the pesticide

options.label: D
options.text: Adults from the clinic without the liver disease who are not exposed to the pesticide

questions.correct_answer: B. Adults in the same community without the liver disease who are not exposed to the pesticide

questions.text: A public health researcher is outlining the steps involved in conducting a case-control study. Which of the following steps are included in case-control studies? Multiple response type: 1. Follow up 2. Matching 3. Selection/Allocation 4. Inference of result data

A regional health organization conducted a cohort study on 5,000 factory workers who were exposed to a particular industrial chemical over a ten-year period and found that 50 subjects developed a rare liver disease. Concurrently, in the general population in the catchment area of the organization, out of 5,000 non-exposed subjects, only 5 developed the same liver disease. What is the relative risk (RR) for developing the liver disease in the exposed workers compared to the non-exposed individuals?

A 45-year-old epidemiologist is reviewing the criteria for establishing a causal association in the etiology of a disease. Among these criteria, one is often considered the most challenging to establish. Which criterion is the most difficult to establish in causal association?

A health department is monitoring an area previously affected by an epidemic. They need to declare the area free of the epidemic based on the absence of new cases for a specific duration. Which of the following criteria is used to declare an area free of an epidemic?

options.label: A
options.text: Till the last secondary case recovers

options.label: B
options.text: No new case reported for the incubation period of the disease since the last case

options.label: C
options.text: No new case reported for twice the incubation period of the disease since the last case

options.label: D
options.text: No new case reported for 6 months since the last case

questions.correct_answer: C. No new case reported for twice the incubation period of the disease since the last case

questions.text: A 1-year-old child is brought to the clinic for immunization. The child received the first dose of the DPT vaccine at 6 weeks old but missed the subsequent doses. What is the appropriate next step in the vaccination schedule?
questions.correct_answer: C. Administer the 2nd dose of DPT

questions.text: A 3-year-old child with a diagnosis of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis is about to begin treatment with immunosuppressive medication. Considering the impact of immunosuppressive therapy, which of the following statements are true regarding vaccination? Vaccinate as per schedule Give Pneumococcal vaccine as per schedule Only killed vaccines should be given OPV should not be given to siblings

A pediatrician is providing immunization guidance for a child who recently received immunoglobulin therapy. Which of the following statements is true regarding the administration of vaccines in this context?

options.label: A
options.text: Two live vaccines should not be given together

options.label: B
options.text: Live and killed vaccines should not be given together

options.label: C
options.text: Immunoglobulin should not be given for at least 6 weeks when a live vaccine is administered

options.label: D
options.text: Live vaccine should not be given to pregnant women

questions.correct_answer: D. Live vaccine should not be given to pregnant women
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Live vaccine should not be given to pregnant women

questions.text: A laboratory technician is evaluating the effectiveness of various disinfectants in a clinical setting. Which of the following is assessed using the Rideal-Walker coefficient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Germicidal power of a disinfectant
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Germicidal power of a disinfectant

questions.text: Which of the following sources are considered not useful much in Evidence-based medicine? Personal exposure Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT) Case report Meta-analysis Systematic review
A 32-year-old woman with a history of recurrent Trichomoniasis infection is advised to undergo a Pap smear test. She asks what the test is for. What would be your response?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a screening test for cervical cancer

options.label: B
options.text: It's a diagnostic test for cervical cancer

options.label: C
options.text: It's a screening test for cancer of the female genital tract

options.label: D
options.text: It's a diagnostic test for Trichomoniasis infection

questions.correct_answer: A. It's a screening test for cervical cancer
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It's a screening test for cervical cancer

questions.text: A researcher is discussing the Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve with medical students. Which of the following statements is true about the ROC curve?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a method of evaluating the quality/performance of tests

options.label: B
options.text: It is plotted as test Sensitivity as the x-coordinate versus its 1-Specificity (False positive rate FPR) as the y-coordinate

options.label: C
options.text: A perfect test has an area under the ROC curve (AUROCC) of >1

options.label: D
options.text: A decrease in sensitivity results in a decrease in specificity

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a method of evaluating the quality/performance of tests
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It is a method of evaluating the quality/performance of tests

questions.text: A 45-year-old man undergoes a diagnostic test for a particular disease. The test has a sensitivity of 0.90 and a specificity of 0.90. The prevalence of the disease in the population is 10%. What is the probability that a person who tests positive for this disease actually has it?
A researcher is designing a study and aims to ensure that the findings can be applied to other settings and populations outside the study sample. What is this aspect of the study called?
Which of the following organisms is known to have endogenous transmission in India?

A 6-year-old child is brought to the clinic with a fever and an itchy rash. The clinician suspects chickenpox and reviews its characteristics. Which of the following statements about chickenpox is incorrect?

options.label: D
options.text: Single stage of rash is seen

questions.correct_answer: D. Single stage of rash is seen
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Single stage of rash is seen

questions.text: A pediatrician is evaluating a newborn for congenital rubella syndrome (CRS) and reviews the common manifestations associated with this condition. Which of the following is not typically associated with congenital rubella syndrome?

A 55-year-old patient with a long-standing history of diabetes is diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB). Considering the interplay between diabetes and TB, which of the following statements is true about TB in diabetic patients?

A 28-year-old man presents to the clinic with jaundice, dark urine, and right upper quadrant abdominal pain. He mentions feeling generally unwell and fatigued for the past few weeks. Laboratory tests reveal positive HBsAg and positive IgM anti-HBc antibodies. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 30-year-old patient of cholera is being monitored. Best management is?

A public health official is tasked with controlling the spread of rabies in an urban population. Considering both logic and cost-effectiveness, which of the following approaches would be most appropriate?

options.label: A
options.text: Test all the dogs for rabies

options.label: B
options.text: Remove stray dogs and vaccinate the dog population

options.label: C
options.text: Administer rabies vaccine to the entire human population

questions.correct_answer: B. Remove stray dogs and vaccinate the dog population
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Remove stray dogs and vaccinate the dog population

questions.text: Which of the following is the ‘Yellow Fever’ vaccine strain?

A 2-year-old child in an endemic area is due for vaccination against Japanese encephalitis. The healthcare provider reviews the vaccination guidelines. Which of the following statements about the Japanese encephalitis vaccine is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Booster doses are given after 1 year and repeated every 3 years

options.label: B
options.text: Not given for infants less than 6 months of age

options.label: C
options.text: Two primary doses are given to children aged 1-3 years

options.label: D
options.text: In endemic areas, vaccination is given to cover children aged 1-9 years

questions.correct_answer: D. In endemic areas, vaccination is given to cover children aged 1-9 years
questions.explanation: Ans. D) In endemic areas, vaccination is given to cover children aged 1-9 years

questions.text: What was the Framingham Heart Study designed to evaluate?
Which of the following is not true about MALA-N?

options.label: A
options.text: Ethinyl estradiol is 30 mcg per pill

options.label: C
options.text: Contains 60 mg Ferrous fumarate in last 7 pills

options.label: D
options.text: 2+2 pills should be used for Emergency contraception

questions.correct_answer: D. 2+2 pills should be used for Emergency contraception

questions.text: A pregnant woman who is HIV-positive is concerned about the risk of transmitting the virus to her baby. Which of the following statements about mother-to-child transmission of HIV is true?

options.label: C
options.text: Transmission is directly related to the maternal viral load

options.label: D
options.text: Nevirapine is the modality of choice for prevention

questions.correct_answer: C. Transmission is directly related to the maternal viral load
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Transmission is directly related to the maternal viral load

questions.text: A public health official is studying the endemic regions for Kala-azar in India. Which of the following states is not endemic for Kala-azar?

A 40-year-old man comes to the clinic with a persistent cough, fever, and weight loss for the past two months. Despite having TB-like symptoms, his initial sputum samples tested negative for TB. However, his chest X-ray strongly suggests tuberculosis. Under the National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP), what should be the next step in his management?
A public health official is looking for data on a particular disease, geographical distribution is shown below. Identify the disease?

Match the following NPCB (National Programme for Control of Blindness) categories of visual impairment and blindness: Column 1 A. < 6/18 to 6/60 B. < 6/60 to 3/60 C. < 3/60 to 1/60 D. < 1/60 to perception of light Column 2 I. Economic Blindness II. Manifest Blindness III. Social Blindness IV. Low Vision
Which of the following statements is not true about NACO's sentinel surveillance of HIV/AIDS?

A town with a population of 100,000 was under surveillance for malaria for one year. During this period, 100 residents tested positive for malaria using a thick smear test. What is the Annual Parasite Incidence (API) for malaria in this town?
Under which ministry does the Biomedical waste management operate?

options.label: C
options.text: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

questions.correct_answer: D. Ministry of Environment and Forests
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Ministry of Environment and Forests

questions.text: A demographer is analyzing the population growth stages in India. What characterizes the late expanding stage of the population in India?

options.label: A
options.text: Birth rate stationary, death rate continues to fall

options.label: B
options.text: Death rate declines faster than birth rate

options.label: C
options.text: Birth rate declines, death rate same

options.label: D
options.text: Birth rate is less than death rate

questions.correct_answer: B. Death rate declines faster than birth rate
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Death rate declines faster than birth rate

questions.text: In a community with a total population of 10,000, there are 2,000 children aged 0-6 years. Among individuals older than 7 years, 4,000 are literate. What is the effective literacy rate in this community?
Demographers believe that achieving the demographic goal of a Net Reproduction Rate (NRR) of 1 can be accomplished only if the couple protection rate exceeds what percentage?

A 32-year-old woman is discussing contraceptive options with her healthcare provider and asks about the reliability of different methods. The provider explains that the failure rate of contraceptives is commonly assessed using a specific index. Which method is used to assess contraceptive failure?
A 28-year-old woman has been using DMPA for contraception. True statement is?

options.label: A
options.text: CHHAYA is the new brand name under RCH program

options.label: B
options.text: Helps in regularisation of menstrual cycles

options.label: D
options.text: Dose is 200 mg IM every 2 months

questions.text: A 37-year-old well-educated woman is seeking advice on temporary contraceptive methods. Which of the following would be the most appropriate choice for her?
A lactating woman in her first six months postpartum is discussing her nutritional needs with her dietitian. What is the additional daily energy requirement for her during this period?

In a given population, there were 4050 total births in a year. Among these, there were 50 stillbirths, 50 neonates died within the first 7 days of life, and 150 neonates died within 8-28 days of life. What is the neonatal mortality rate in this population?
A preterm baby with 1.9 kg weight has been delivered just now, through normal vaginal delivery. What is your recommendation for initiation of exclusive breast feeding?

options.label: A
options.text: Should not be done till child attains 2 kg weight

options.label: B
options.text: Should not be done. Shift to formula feeding

questions.correct_answer: C. Start at the earliest possible
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Start at the earliest possible

questions.text: Under factory Act 1948, A 17-year-old boy would be classified as?

options.label: C
options.text: Both a child as well as adolescent

questions.text: A pediatric nutritionist is assessing various methods to evaluate malnutrition in children that do not rely on age-based criteria. Which of the following measures is considered age-independent for determining malnutrition?
A nutritionist is analyzing different sources of dietary protein to determine which has the highest NPU. Which of the following foods has the maximum NPU?
A 45-year-old patient presents with symptoms of easy bruising and a tendency to bleed. Which vitamin deficiency is most likely responsible for these symptoms?

Which of the following statements about iodine deficiency disorders is true? Exclusively found in Himalayan goiter belt Goiter prevalence of 10% is cut-off value for endemicity Salt is the source of Iodine Only monitored by blood thyroid test Include only Goitre

Which of the following statements about HIV is true? Sexual route is most common route Blood route has highest chances of transmission Needles/syringes route has least chances of transmission First HIV case was detected in 1983 Discovered by Fleming

A 28-year-old bodybuilder reports consuming maize daily as part of his diet. He begins to experience symptoms of vitamin deficiency. Which vitamin deficiency is most likely associated with this consumption?
A 45-year-old man diagnosed with neuro-lathyrism seeks advice on treatment options. Which vitamin is useful in the treatment of neuro-lathyrism?
Which of the following can facilitate acculturation?
The Kuppuswamy Scale is based on which of the following factors?

options.label: A
options.text: Income of the family, number of livestock, number of acres of farmland

options.label: B
options.text: Income of the family, number of members in the family, education of the head of the family

options.label: C
options.text: Number of vehicles in the family, occupation of the head of the family, education of the head of the family

options.label: D
options.text: Income, occupation of the head of the family, education of the head of the family

questions.correct_answer: D. Income, occupation of the head of the family, education of the head of the family
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Income, occupation of the head of the family, education of the head of the family

questions.text: What is the Geobacillus sterothermophilus used to assess sufficiency of?
A public health official is compiling a list of waterborne diseases for an awareness campaign. Which of the following is NOT an example of a waterborne disease?
A meteorologist is looking for an instrument to measure low wind velocity and cooling power. Which of the following instruments should be used?
What is the SI unit used to measure the brightness of a point source of light?

A municipal engineer is planning to construct a sanitary landfill using the trench method for a population of 10,000 people. The landfill pit will have a depth of 2 meters. How much area is required per year for this landfill?
A public health specialist is studying diseases that are associated with mosquito vectors. Which of the following diseases is NOT associated with mosquitoes?
A healthcare worker is learning about the proper disposal of medical waste. Where should Uro-bag with blood be disposed of?
During a mass casualty incident, triage is conducted to prioritize patient care based on the likelihood of survival. What does the black color in triage signify?
A 45-year-old industrial worker presents with symptoms of lead poisoning. What is the most common mode of absorption of inorganic lead in industrial settings leading to lead poisoning?
A 50-year-old factory worker presents with mesothelioma. Which industry is most commonly associated with this condition as an industrial hazard?
A medical education professional is explaining different formats of group discussions used in academic settings. Which of the following best defines a panel discussion?
What is the logical sequence in the planning cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: Monitoring & evaluation, Programming & implementation, Assessment of resources, Analysis of existing health situation

options.label: B
options.text: Analysis of existing health situation, Assessment of resources, Programming & implementation, Monitoring & evaluation

options.label: C
options.text: Analysis of existing health situation, Programming & implementation, Assessment of resources, Monitoring & evaluation

options.label: D
options.text: Assessment of resources, Analysis of existing health situation, Programming & implementation, Monitoring & evaluation

questions.correct_answer: B. Analysis of existing health situation, Assessment of resources, Programming & implementation, Monitoring & evaluation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Analysis of existing health situation, Assessment of resources, Programming & implementation, Monitoring & evaluation

questions.text: Which of the following agents is not considered one of the important and potential agents for bioterrorism?
Identify the statistical diagram shown in the photograph below:
